page.title: 04Transport
page.content: Burton Station is on the main line from the north-east to the south-west. Now only a small island platform, northbound trains carry many commuters to Derby, whereas southbound trains call at Burton en route to Birmingham. The East Staffordshire District Council operates a network of bus services in and around the town. Apart from several vehicles bedecked in advertisements for local firms, the buses are maroon and cream. At this time one of the larger independent operators, Stevenson's, based at Uttoxeter, and operating into the town mainly from the north of the county, is merging with the local authority. For the time being, though, the distinctive yellow and black livery will remain a distinctive and popular feature of the town's streets.
